alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 1:10PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central La Paz County through 200 PM MST... At 110 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brenda, or 36 miles southeast of Parker, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Brenda and Kofa Wildlife Refuge. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 22 and 47. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
